content.title: State Disability Scholarship (Scholarship for Persons with Disabilities)
content.details: The scheme 'State Disability Scholarship' was launched by the Department of Social Welfare, Government of Nagaland to provide financial assistance to students from Class I to Class VIII who have a disability of 40% and above.
benefits: The physically disabled students from Class I to Class VIII are provided with scholarships ranging from ₹200/-.
eligibility: Scholarship for Persons with Disability will be applicable for all the inhabitants of Nagaland.
The applicant should be from an Institution which has a valid AISHE/UDISE Code.
The annual income of the applicant’s parents/guardians from all sources must not exceed ₹2.50 lakhs.
Disabled Students should have the benchmark disability (40% and above) to be admissible under this scheme.
Scholarship for Persons with Disabilities will be applicable from Class I to Class VIII.
Students who have failed in their last examination (repeaters) are not eligible to apply.
Applicants must not be a beneficiary of any other scholarship scheme.
Scholarship will be provided to all types of disabilities as defined in the Rights of Persons with Disabilities Rules 2017.
content.application_process: Online - via CSCs. All eligible students shall apply through the Common Scholarship Portal: https://scholarship.nagaland.gov.in
documents_required: Xerox copy of the Progress Report of the last class/year passed.
Xerox copy of the front page of Bank Passbook.
Original Income Certificate (Fresh applicants only) issued in the current financial year.

faqs.question: What is the State Disability Scholarship?
faqs.answer: The State Disability Scholarship is a scheme initiated by the Department of Social Welfare, Government of Nagaland. It aims to offer financial aid to students from Class I to Class VIII who have a disability of 40% and above.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for the State Disability Scholarship?
faqs.answer: The scholarship scheme will be applicable for Persons with Disability who are inhabitants of Nagaland.

faqs.question: What is the financial assistance provided under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Physically disabled students from Class I to Class VIII can receive scholarships ranging from ₹200 onwards. The scholarship amount may vary from Class to Class.

faqs.question: What is the income criteria for eligibility?
faqs.answer: The annual income of the applicant’s parents/guardians should not exceed ₹2.50 lakhs from all sources.

faqs.question: What level of disability qualifies for the scholarship?
faqs.answer: Students must have a benchmark disability of 40% and above to be eligible for this scheme.

faqs.question: From which classes is the scholarship applicable?
faqs.answer: The scholarship is applicable from Class I to Class VIII.

faqs.question: Are repeaters eligible to apply for this scholarship?
faqs.answer: No, students who have failed in their last examination (repeaters) are not eligible to apply.

faqs.question: Can applicants avail of other scholarship schemes simultaneously?
faqs.answer: No, applicants must not be beneficiaries of any other scholarship scheme.

faqs.question: What types of disabilities are considered under this scheme?
faqs.answer: All types of disabilities as defined in the Rights of Persons with Disabilities Rules 2017 are eligible for this scholarship.

faqs.question: How does one apply for the State Disability Scholarship?
faqs.answer: All eligible students shall apply through the Common Scholarship Portal: https://scholarship.nagaland.gov.in

faqs.question: Can I edit my application after submission?
faqs.answer: No, once an application is submitted, you cannot make changes. Ensure all information is accurate before submitting your application.

faqs.question: How can I track the status of my scholarship application?
faqs.answer: Log in to your account on the portal and/or navigate to the 'Track Application' section. You can check the status of your application there.
